chargeHist.descr: Take and Drive Vehicle w/o Consent
Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+)

result.execSummary:
The defendant was charged with both OWI (5th or 6th) and Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th). The defendant was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th) and the other charge, Operating w/ PAC (5th or 6th) was dismissed by the court.

  • Jack Paul Bartelt was found guilty of OWI (5th or 6th), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.63(1)(a).
  • Jack Paul Bartelt was found guilty of Operating While Revoked (Rev due to alc/contr subst/refusal 4th+), an unclassified misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 343.44(1)(b).
  • Jack Paul Bartelt was found guilty of Bail Jumping-Misdemeanor, a class A misdemeanor, Wisconsin Statutes 946.49(1)(a).

Charge(s) in this case were read in to this or other case(s). A "read in" charge is a charge that is dismissed as part of a plea agreement, however:

  • The defendant agrees to have the court consider the charge(s) when sentencing for another crime, under Wis. Stats. 973.20(1g)(b); and
  • The defendant cannot be prosecuted for these charge(s) in the future.

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.notes: On driver's license and all vehicles titled in his name commencing upon issuance of valid DL.

miscConds.notes: To be paid at no less than $100.00/month commencing first day of first month following release from incarceration.

The defendant must maintain/obtain full time employment/school that consists of at least 35 hrs/week.

When not full time employed/school, the defendant must apply for at least 3 jobs per week and report progress monthly to P&P with pertinent information in regards to applications.  The defendant must only apply for jobs qualified for - must accept any job offered - must not engage in any conduct that could result in the termination of his/her employment/school.
The defendant may not consume or possess alcohol and no entry into any taverns or bars.
The defendant must submit a DNA sample.

The defendant must undergo an AODA assessment and follow thru with all recommendations.

The defendant must attend at least one AA/NA or similar self help program meeting per week and is to provide proof of attendance to P&P agent..

timeConds.notes: Huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3).
As deemed appropriate by P&P and is to be completed within the first year of probation commencing upon release from incarceration.

records.addlTxt: State's Motion and Order for Adjournment - signed by Judge on 12/28/15.

Defendant Jack Paul Bartelt in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 4:06 PM. State - matters are not resolved together at this point, here for INIT on 15CF196 and FPT on 15CF127. Burns and Bartelt provided with complaint in Court for 15CF196. Court reads charges and penalties. Burns and Bartelt understand charges and penalties. Burns waives further reading, requests PH, will waive time limits. Court considers time limits waived, sets for PH and believes it will be waived, on 1/11/16 at 9:15 AM. On 15CF127. State - resolved - defendant will plead G to count #1 as alleged, DRI, #2, plead to #3 and #4 as alleged - 9 months incarceration - concurrent to each other and to count #1 - court costs only on each count, #5 - DRI, #6 - dismissed, acknowledge four prior OWI convictions, 3 years probation with conditons of: impose and stay a sentence of 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES, stayed, place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 365 days in the FC jail, reimburse City of Crandon in the amount $35.00 for blood draw, fine of $4200.00, DL revocation for 36 months, IID for 36 months,  no consumption of alcohol, AODA, employment/school, no entry into any bars or taverns, AA/NA meeting once a week. Burns agrees as does Bartelt. Court dismisses count #6, court DRI counts #2 and #5. Bartelt pleads G to counts #1, #3 and #4 as alleged. Court has plea questionnaire, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his constitutional rights by entering his plea and right to JT, accepts plea, adjudges guilty, proceed to sentencing. State makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation. Burns makes final argument prior to sentencing - follow joint recommendation - provides court with character references of the defendant that she was just provided - credit for 14 days (stipulated) - asks court to allow defendant to also work as trustee in the jail. State has no objections to the statements.  Court reviews statement provided by Burns. Bartelt withholds comment. Court sentences the defendant to the following: count #1 - 6 years in the WI State Prison System consisting of 3 years of initial confinement followed by 3 years of ES - not eligible for any programs if revoked, stayed, place on probation for 3 years with conditions of: 365 days in FC jail - huber allowed - eligible for community service under 973.03(3) - report today - credit for 14 days, no possession or consumption of alcohol and no entry into any bars, AODA and follow thru, attend at least one AA or similar self help program/meeting per week and provide verification of attendance, maintain/obtain full time employment/school, 100 hours of community service within the first year or probation after release from incarceration, reimburse City of Crandon for blood draw in amount of $35.00 - paid thru probation, 3 year DL revocation, IID on DL and all vehicles titled in his name for 3 years, fine on count #1 of $4200.00 - paid thru probation but at no less than $200.00/month commencing upon release from incarceration, counts #3 and #4 - 9 months in FC jail on each count - concurrent to each other and to count #1, costs on each count - paid thru probation on count #1, submit DNA sample with expungment verbage, no possession of firearms, no voting rights, right to appeal, adjourned.

Defendant Jack Paul Bartelt in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 3:17 PM. Burns - not resolved - set for trial, 1 day. State agrees. Burns has gone over the ramifications of rejecting the plea offer and he understands. Court continues bond, JA will set for JT with counsel as an analyst is needed.

Defendant Jack Paul Bartelt in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns appearing by phone.  Jodie L. Bednar appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called 2:17 PM. State is not present. Burns requesting an adjournment due to blood tests results not in yet.  Final pre-trial scheduled for November 18, 2015 at 02:30 pm.
Legal Blood Draw - Reciept billed to CPD
No consumption of alcohol, not to enter or remain in any bar or tavern except for employment purposes and must leave/exit the premises upon completion of work shift.

Defendant Jack Paul Bartelt in court with attorney Mary L.R. Burns.  Defendant Jack Paul Bartelt in custody and appears via video from FOSO.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 1:33 PM. State - believes it will be a waiver of PH and have filed the Information that mirrors complaint in anticipation of that. Burns agrees and has also filed a bond motion. Bartelt agrees. Court has waiver of PH form, goes thru it, finds the defendant has freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his right to PH, finds probable cause, binds over for trial. Burns has Information that mirrors the complaint, waives reading of it, will proceed to ARGN and pleads NG to all counts. Court accepts plea and will hear bond motion. Burns makes argument for signature bond for stated reasons. State - bond - objects to signature bond but would consider a reduction in the cash bond, $1000.00 cash and would like a condition of no operation of a motor vehicle. Burns believes family can come up with $500.00 cash. Court - bond - reduces bond to $5000.00 signature bond with no consumption of alcohol, not to enter or remain in any bar or tavern except for employment purposes and must leave/exit the premises upon completion of work shift. Court sets for FPT.  Final pre-trial scheduled for October 7, 2015 at 02:15 pm.
No consumption of alcohol, no contact with victims unless they go thru the waiver process.

Defendant Jack Paul Bartelt in court, in custody and appears via video from FOSO with Attorney Mary Burns appearing in the Courtroom.  Charles James Simono appeared for the State of Wisconsin. Called at 9:25 AM. Bartelt does not have complaint. Burns has complaint but has not gone over it with the defendant. Court reads charges and penalties. Bartelt and Burns understand charges and penalties. Burns waives further reading, requests PH, would like to address bond. Burns makes bond argument - requests lower cash bond ($500.00 cash) for states reasons . State - bond - objects to reduction in bond less than $2500.00 cash for stated reasons with no consumption of alcohol, no entry into any bars or taverns, no operation of a motor vehicle. Court - bond - will reduce bond to $2500.00 with no consumption of alcohol, no contact with victims unless they go thru the waiver process. Burns wants PH within time limits. Court sets for PH within time limits. State would like to do the refusal hearing as well on the same date and time (15TR547).  Preliminary hearing scheduled for August 27, 2015 at 09:30 am.
